alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds in which hydrogen is bonded to a more electropositive element or group. Usually, they contain one or more hydrogen centers having nucleophilic, reducing, or basic properties.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic hydrides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds containing a nickel atom.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic nickel compounds

class.description: Inorganic compounds belonging to either the alkaline earth metal hydrides, alkaline earth metal nitrides, alkaline earth metal oxides, alkaline earth metal sulfides.
class.name: Transition metal organides

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as transition metal hydrides. These are inorganic hydride compounds in which the heaviest metal atom is a transition metal.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic hydride compounds in which the heaviest metal atom is a transition metal.
direct_parent.name: Transition metal hydrides

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic hydride compounds in which the heaviest metal atom is a transition metal.
subclass.name: Transition metal hydrides

superclass.description: Compounds that contains both metal and non metal atoms.
superclass.name: Mixed metal/non-metal compounds
